Sentencas: The idea of using the sol-gel technique for producing low-cost components for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application has attracted great interest.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: Besides its economic advantages, the sol-gel technique additionally offers the chance to reduce either the thickness of the electrolyte and therefore to reduce ohmic resistances or to lower the sintering temperature of single components like the electrolyte layer, due to the clearly reduced particle sizes of colloidal distributed particles in the sol.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: The work presented here deals with the development of sols and their application in combination with yttria fully stabilized zirconia mixed-oxide powders for the preparation of screen-printing pastes.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: Besides physical, chemical and thermal characterization of the sols, variations of the composition of the sol as well as of the pastes composed of sol and mixed-oxide powder were evaluated for preparing dense, gas-tight layers sintered at various temperatures, resulting in sufficient gas-tightness to ensure high power density SOFCs.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: Additionally, technological screen-printing parameters were studied.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: Single cell tests (50 mm x 50 mm) revealed current densities of approx.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application
Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application

Sentencas: These values are comparable to current densities obtained by cells based on normal electrolyte layers, which were prepared in parallel.
Titulo: Screen printing of sol-gel-derived electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application
